-e ---

Ugaritic letter 𐎜 W 𐤅 ᵝủᵡ 𓊪𓇐 bogʰ phoʾ ᵠủᵡ ʾuu

𐎜 Fủ 𓇋 fur Feder ᵛủ ʷủ ( 𓇋 𓋴 𓊪 𓏏 𓄛 ⋍ 𐎜 𐎘 𐎔 𐎚 )

𐎜 Fủ 𓇋 für Fjotr 𐎜𐎎 ≈ ܝܸܡܵܐ yimma

𐎜 Fủ 𓇋 für wind 𒅎𒊒 imrᵗ ≈ 𐎜𐎎𐎚 ủmt

𐎜 ᵡủ ủᵡ 𐎜𐎎𐎚 ủmt #kimtu חמולה khamúla

𐎜𐎎 ủm أُمّ ʔumm ܝܸܡܵܐ yimma

𐎜 ᵝủ 𐎜𐎎 ᵝủm बिमा bima "mother"

𐎜 ᶴủᵐ ᶴủⁿ ủᶴ sh 𓆷 #sA 𓇐 #sm swamp 𓇏 #sxt scot 𓈉 Shan 山 in

𓇋 𓋴 𓊪 𓏏 𓄛 ⋍ 𐎜 𐎘 𐎔 𐎚 ᵝủṯpt אַשְׁפָּה ʾašpā™ 𐎜 𐎘 𐎔 𐎚 (quiver for arrows)

𐎜 𐎘 ≈ 𓇋 𓋴 ≈ ʾaš : š completly carried by 𐎘 ≈ 𒋙 ŠU₂ so this adds near zero evidence

𐎆 𐎜 pUr ↔ 𐎁 B 𐎄DELTA 𓅨vr

𐎜 ⋍ 𓇋 in

𐎜𐎘𐎔𐎚 ủṯpt > 𓇋 𓋴 𓊪 𓏏 𓄛 quiver (for arrows) אַשְׁפָּה ʾašpā™

No doubt if ủ ≈ أُمّ ʔu ≈ ܝܸܡܵܐ yi developed from a proper consonant, it was at one stage a peculiar xenotic one

bog bush

The leading 𐎜 ᵝủ hypothesis is stronger than the dangling ᵡủ / ủᶴ kh / sh hypothesis

One ancestral reading compatible with all the evidence would be

𐎜 𓇏 𓇐 bogʰ 𐎜 ᵝủᶴ bush Buxbaum 𐌱𐌰𐌲𐌼𐍃 bagms 𐎜 ᵝủᵡ Buche Birke birch foxtail? 𐎜 ᵝủᵡ box ≈ 𓊪 𑀩 𒇥 𐎜 ᵝủᵡ •bukh •bugh > ủꜥ ủꜣ ủꜤ ủʿ ủ꜂ > أُمّ ʔu 𐎜 𓇏 𓇐 𓆷 𓈉 Berg

𐎜 box 𑀩 <> animal pen

Semitic realization

In any case the dangling ủᵡ clearly moved to the front ᵡủ as in 𐎜𐎎𐎚 ᵡủmt #kimtu חמולה khamúla

Or rather, in the Ugaritic alphabet was ambiguous in consonantal CV/VC readings.

∑ SUM 𐎜 ᶴủᵐ ᶴủⁿ

# active 𐎖𐎗𐎒𐎜 qrsuⁿ #kušānu "fleece, skin, wineskin"

passive

𐎜𐎎𐎚 ủmt #kimtu חמולה khamúla

indirect

𐎜 ≈ 𓇐 #sm swamp 𐎜 ≈ 𓈉 Shan 山 𐎜 ≈ 𓆷 #sA

pure

𐎜𐎎 um "mother" 𐎜𐎎𐎚 umt "family, clan"
